title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંત ચાલ્યા સહુ મળી, મહામુક્ત તણી જે મંડળી; 
સર્વે ગુજરદેશમાં ગયા, કૈંક પુરમાં પઢવા રહ્યા.
gujarati.context: The saint has gone, leaving us with a legacy of spiritual freedom; all the devotees have crossed the land of Gujarat to reach their ultimate destination.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગી ગયા સર્વે ઘેર્ય<RHYME_211433>, થઈ સુખી સહુ બહુ પેર્ય<RHYME_211433>; 
જોઈ લીલાને ચડી ખુમારી, ઊતરે નહી કેની ઊતારી.
gujarati.context: The good company departed, leaving behind great joy and a lot of tears; they left without notice, like Lila's playfulness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કરે ચર્ચા પરસ્પર જ્યારે, થાય કેફભરી વાત ત્યારે; 
સહુને ચિત્તે ચડ્યો રંગચોળ<RHYME_211436>, આવી અંતરે મસ્તિ અતોળ<RHYME_211436>.
gujarati.context: When people discuss and argue, it's usually about something that bothers them; meanwhile, true understanding is often hidden within, like a subtle fragrance that only reveals itself later.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
થયું પ્રકટ જાણે કલ્યાણ, નહિ ઉધારી વાતની વાણ્ય; 
હોય પરચા હજારોહજાર<RHYME_211437>, જાણે જન ન જાણે સંસાર<RHYME_211437>.
gujarati.context: One's own good fortune is known, but the value of relationships is not realized until they are lost; countless tears may fall, yet the value of human connections remains unknown.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જે કોઈ સતસંગી નામ કાવે, પંચવ્રતને પાળે પળાવે; 
તે આ લોક પરલોકને માંઈ<RHYME_211439>, રહે સુખી તે જન સદાઈ<RHYME_211439>.
gujarati.context: One who has a good company name, will get protection from the five thieves and attain happiness in this life and the afterlife.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જે દિ આવે આ દેહનો કાળ<RHYME_211440>, તે દિ આવે તેડવા દયાળ<RHYME_211440>; 
રથ વેલ વિમાન ને વાજિ, મૂકે દેહ ઘણું થઈ રાજી.
gujarati.context: As the body's time arrives, so does the soul's departure; and just as a chariot reaches its destination, the body finally surrenders to death.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કહે આવ્યા છે તેડવા નાથ<RHYME_211441>, હું જાઉં છું મહારાજને સાથ<RHYME_211441>; 
માનજ્યો મારું હિતવચન<RHYME_211442>, સહુ સ્વામીનું કરજ્યો ભજન<RHYME_211442>.
gujarati.context: I will go with the king's permission, taking my beloved along; My happiness is in speaking of my own good, and worshipping at my Lord's altar.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહીને મૂકે છે દેહ<RHYME_211443>, સર્વે જાણે સતસંગી તેહ<RHYME_211443>; 
કૈંક કુસંગી તે પણ જાણે, થાય દર્શન પ્રકટ પ્રમાણે.
gujarati.context: The body remains silent about its intentions, yet everyone knows a true friend when they see one; even an enemy can be recognized by the clear signs of their presence.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જ્યારે મરે કુસંગીમાં કોઈ<RHYME_211445>, નજરે જમકિંકરને જોઈ<RHYME_211445>; 
જાતાં જમહાથ જોઈ કુસંગી, પછી સમજી થાય સતસંગી.
gujarati.context: When someone is among the unrighteous, they look towards the wicked; afterwards, they realize it was actually a gathering of like-minded individuals.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ વધતો જાય સતસંગ<RHYME_211447>, જોઈ રીત્ય ચિત્તે ચડે રંગ<RHYME_211447>; 
આવે સંત કરે બહુ વાત<RHYME_211448>, તે સાંભળી થાય રળિયાત<RHYME_211448>.
gujarati.context: As one's spiritual companions grow, their thoughts become vibrant with color; a saintly person speaks much, and people listen intently to what they have to say.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પૂર્ણપુરુષોત્તમ જેહ<RHYME_211443>, મળે પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ તેહ<RHYME_211443>; 
તેના સંત પંચવ્રતે પૂરા, એ આગળે બીજા તો અધૂરા.
gujarati.context: The perfect person is one who has fulfilled their responsibilities and kept their word; they have five virtues that are complete, while others may still be incomplete.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવા સંત શિરોમણી જેહ<RHYME_211443>, ફરે દેશ પ્રદેશમાં તેહ<RHYME_211443>; 
જેનાં આગન્યાકારી છે અંગ<RHYME_211450>, કેદિ ન કરે વચનનો ભંગ<RHYME_211450>.
gujarati.context:
A true saint wanders freely across the land, 
Their words are unbroken and truthful as their limb.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
તેને આપિયું એમ વચન<RHYME_211451>, જાજ્યો તવરે મળી મુનિજન<RHYME_211451>; 
આવી શક્યા તો આવશું અમે, નહિ તો નહાજ્યો નર્મદામાં તમે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

"If I could meet you, I would surely arrive; otherwise, stay in Narmada and don't come."
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવી સંતને આગન્યા આપી, પછી જાણ્યું વધ્યા ઘણા પાપી; 
તૈયે કાળને આગન્યા કીધી, મુવા પાપી જીવ બહુ વિધિ.
gujarati.context: As one's past karma ripens, many sinful acts are revealed; later on, the consequences of such actions unfold in various ways.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પોતે છાના રહ્યા ઘણું શ્યામ<RHYME_211454>, કાળે કીધું છે કાળનું કામ<RHYME_211454>; 
પોતે લીધો તપસ્વીનો વેશ<RHYME_211455>, રહ્યા ગુપ્ત વધારિયા કેશ<RHYME_211455>.
gujarati.context: The speaker has spent many sleepless nights, and the result is a task that will take ages to complete; they have taken on the appearance of a ascetic, with hair growing longer in secret.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પહેરે ખેસ ને ઓઢે ચોફાળ<RHYME_211456>, માથે શોભે છે સુંદર વાળ<RHYME_211456>; 
પહેરી ટોપી ઓપી શોભા તણી, શ્યામ મૂર્તિ તે પુષ્ટ છે ઘણી.
gujarati.context: A beautiful woman adorns her hair with elegance, and her beauty is enhanced by the ornate style of her headgear. The beauty of Shyam's idol is also boosted by its embellishments, making it all the more wonderful.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
રહે છાના ન જાણે કોઈ જન<RHYME_211458>, કરે એકાંતિ દાસ દર્શન<RHYME_211458>; 
એમ વીતી ગયા બહુ દન<RHYME_211458>, કોઈ જાણી શકે નહિ જન.
gujarati.context: One is alone in knowing their own struggles, but silently bears the burden of others' troubles; many have passed through this state, yet none can truly understand another's pain.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવ્યો છે વસંત માસ<RHYME_211459>, સુણી વસંત સાંભરિયા દાસ<RHYME_211459>; 
પછી બોલિયા દીનદયાળ<RHYME_211460>, લાવો તેડી સંત તતકાળ<RHYME_211460>.
gujarati.context: Spring has arrived, bringing with it the joy and beauty of spring's arrival; now is the time to celebrate with the Lord at this opportune moment.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
થઈ ખબર આવિયા સંત<RHYME_211461>, વાલો રાજી રમવા વસંત<RHYME_211461>; 
પહેરી વસ્ત્ર જરીનાં જીવન<RHYME_211462>, ઘણું જન ઉપર્ય પ્રસન્ન<RHYME_211462>.
gujarati.context:
The couplet speaks of spiritual growth and contentment, where one's inner joy is more important than material possessions or external validation.

It emphasizes the value of being at peace with oneself, rather than seeking fleeting happiness from worldly things.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવે સંત મળે ભરી બાથ<RHYME_211441>, જુવે અમૃત દ્રષ્ટિએ નાથ<RHYME_211441>; 
ઘણા દિનના જન હતા પ્યાસી, થયા તૃપ્ત જોઈ અવિનાશી.
gujarati.context: A saintly person's life is filled with spiritual bath and divine vision, untainted by worldly desires. Many people strive for this kind of eternal fulfillment.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથ કહે સુણો દાસ<RHYME_211459>, આ તો જાય છે ફાગણ માસ<RHYME_211459>; 
ગાવો ફાગ ને ધૂમ મચાવો, નિત્ય નાવે અવસર આવો.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the festive month of Fagun as a time when one's worries and troubles are washed away, just like the foggy atmosphere is cleared by the warm breeze. It's a time to let go of daily cares and indulge in celebrations.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કરો રમવા તણો સમાજ<RHYME_211465>, એમ બોલ્યા રાજી થઈ રાજ<RHYME_211465>; 
પછી સંતે કર્યો સરાજામ<RHYME_211466>, હોળી હરિશું રમવા હામ<RHYME_211466>.
gujarati.context: The king said that he will make the entire society happy and full of joy, just like a festival; afterwards, saints came and took over the kingdom, leaving us to playfully enjoy the celebrations.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી કઢાવ્યો રંગ સોરંગ<RHYME_211447>, કેસુ કેસર કસુંબો પતંગ<RHYME_211467>; 
ભર્યા ચરુ કડાયાં ને કડા, વળી ગોળા માટલાં ને ઘડા.
gujarati.context: After a colorful and lively life, one's legacy is left behind like a bird leaving its nest; and just as threads are woven together to create a fabric, the good deeds of our lives become our lasting identity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
લાવ્યા તેલ ગુલાલ અબીર<RHYME_211469>, સજ્જ થયા સખા શૂરવીર<RHYME_211469>; 
પછી નાથ કહે સુણો જન<RHYME_211458>, આપો અમને સખા થઈ પ્રસન<RHYME_211458>.
gujarati.context: When troubles leave and peace arrives, one becomes a brave warrior; afterwards, there's no need to ask anyone else for help, as we've become strong like a lion ourselves.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી દશવીશ સખા લીધા, બેઉ ટોળાં બરોબર કીધાં; 
સાંખ્યયોગી સખા શ્યામ સાથે, લીધી હેમ પિચકારી હાથે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Twenty-five years went by, and many were gathered together; with Shyam as my companion, I earned the world's praise under his guidance.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મગાવિયો રંગ પાસે, ભરી પિચકારી અવિનાશે; 
છાંટી એક એક સહુ માથે, પછી નાખ્યો છે ગુલાલ નાથે.
gujarati.context: After the play, I got a beautiful color at my doorstep; it was filled with impermanence and fragility. One by one, people left me, leaving only red vermilion on my forehead.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સખા સહુ થયા રંગચોળ<RHYME_211436>, પછી મચ્યો છે ખેલ અતોળ<RHYME_211436>; 
છૂટે પિચકારી બહુ છોળે, એકબીજાને ઝાલીને રોળે.
gujarati.context: When friends are united in joyful play, their laughter and excitement know no bounds. Together, they create a whirlwind of fun that's hard to contain.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
નાખે ઉપર અબીર ગુલાલ<RHYME_211473>, તેણે સખા થયા સહુ લાલ<RHYME_211473>; 
વાજે ઢોલ ને દદામા ગડે, કાંસા ત્રાંસાની ધ્રોશ જ પડે.
gujarati.context:
The summary is:

As the red rose blooms above, so too does friendship flourish; when drums beat loudly, the echo of bronze pots resounds.

(Only 2 lines as requested!)
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
લથબથ જૂથ રમે હોળી, સામસામી છે સરખી ટોળી; 
નાથ ઉપર નાખ્યો છે રંગ<RHYME_211447>, તેણે શોભે છે સુંદર અંગ<RHYME_211447>.
gujarati.context: The village is filled with laughter and joy, while the community is united as one. The beauty of this unity is reflected in the harmonious colors of the people's faces.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે વસ્ત્ર રંગાણાં અંગનાં, શ્વેત લાલ થયાં એક રંગનાં; 
મુખ લાલ ને કમળનેણ<RHYME_211477>, શોભે સુંદર તે સુખદેણ<RHYME_211477>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

The entire world is full of colors and hues, but ultimately all things become one uniform color. The beautiful and pleasant result is a lovely happiness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
હસવે દીસે છે દંતપંગતિ, ઓપે અનારકળીથી અતિ; 
બાંધ્યું બોકાનું સુંદર ફેંટે, કસી કમર રૂપાળે રેંટે.
gujarati.context: A smile is seen on the face of a foolish person, but it's like an unripe mango that hasn't matured yet. It's bound to get bruised and damaged like a beautiful butterfly caught in someone's hair.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
છૂટી કસમાં દીસે છે છાતી, તેની શોભા કહી નથી જાતી; 
વેઢ વીંટી ને કડાં છે હાથે, નાથ રમે છે સખાને સાથે.
gujarati.context:
A promise is fragile like a leaf on a tree, its beauty is not appreciated; 
One's own hands are tied by fate, and one dances with others in harmony.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
હોડાહોડમાં કોઈ ન હારે, વચ્ચમાં પડી કોઈ ન વારે; 
એમ રમતાં જામ બેઉ ગિયા, મટી બપોર છાયા નમિયા.
gujarati.context: No one gets defeated in the ocean's waves, nor does anyone get wounded in a fierce battle;
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથે હાથે પાડી તાળી, કરે નામની ધૂન્ય રસાળી; 
કરી ધૂન્ય કહે એમ વાલો, સર્વે નદીએ નાવાને ચાલો.
gujarati.context: After a struggle, one's name is made famous; Then they tell the story of their journey, and all set sail on the river of fame.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પોતે ચડિયા છે ઘોડે, સખા જૂથ સરવે છે જોડે; 
નાવા નીરમાં પેઠા છે નાથ<RHYME_211441>, સહુ નાહ્યા છે શ્યામને સાથ<RHYME_211441>.
gujarati.context: The speaker is saying that they themselves are busy with their own affairs, while others in the group are also occupied with their own tasks; and just like a ship stays anchored in the middle of the river, one stays by the side of one's dear friend.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
નાહી નાથ ને નીસર્યા બારે, કર્યો કુંકુમનો ઇન્દુ ત્યારે; 
પછી અશ્વે થયા અસવાર<RHYME_211486>, આવ્યા મહારાજ ગામ મોઝાર<RHYME_211486>.
gujarati.context: A king who had no power or authority was exiled and forced to wander, but later became a great king of his own village. He rose from poverty to prosperity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંત સર્વે તે આવ્યા, થઈ રસોઈ જમવા બોલાવ્યા; 
પછી પીરસ્યું પોતાને હાથે, એમ જમાડિયા જન નાથે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Afterward, all sages came and said they had come to collect; but they took it for themselves by hand, without giving it to anyone else.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે રીતે કીધા સુખી સંત<RHYME_211461>, કરી લીલા અલૌકિ અત્યંત<RHYME_211461>; 
દિન દશ સુધી સંત રહ્યા, પછી પોતે વળાવાને ગયા.
gujarati.context: The saint lived a happy and carefree life, indulging in whimsical joys. After ten days of bliss, he returned to his true nature.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કારિયાણી ને કુંડળ ગામ<RHYME_211454>, તિયાં સુધી આવ્યા પોતે શ્યામ<RHYME_211454>; 
પછી સહુને શીખ જ કરી, પોતે પાછા વળિયા છે હરિ.
gujarati.context: Shyam went to the village of Kundal till Tiya; after that, he taught others to walk in his footprints, while he himself stayed behind in Harri.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવો કર્યો સમૈયો જીવને, ફાગણ સુદિ પૂનમને દિને; 
તેદિ ગઢડે રમિયા હોળી, સુખી થઈ ગયા સંત ટોળી.
gujarati.context:
Life's journey is completed on the day of full moon in Phagun month, and the saints' happiness is fulfilled.

The rhyme indicates that a spiritual journey comes to an end when one achieves spiritual fulfillment.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૬૫: શ્રીહરિચરિત્રે ગઢડે હુતાશની ઉત્સવ કર્યો
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 65: Shrī Haricharitre Gaḍhaḍe Hutāshanī Utsav Karyo

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sant chālyā sahu maḷī, mahāmukta taṇī je manḍaḷī; <RHYME_1>
Sarve Gujardeshmā gayā, kaik purmā paḍhavā rahyā.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a saintly person who has achieved liberation and is now free from the cycle of birth and death. All worldly desires have been fulfilled, leaving only spiritual wisdom to guide them.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangī gayā sarve gherya, thaī sukhī sahu bahu perya; <RHYME_2>
Joī līlāne chaḍī khumārī, ūtare nahī kenī ūtārī.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context:
When all worldly desires are left behind, one finds true happiness; 
But even after achieving this state of joy, there is still no end to the journey.

transliteration.couplet:
Kare charchā paraspar jyāre, thāy kefbharī vāt tyāre; <RHYME_3>
Sahune chitte chaḍyo rangchoḷ, āvī antare masti atoḷ.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: Love's conversation between each other is sweet, while others' gossiping winds are dispersed. In solitude, the mind is filled with joy and pleasure within.

transliteration.couplet:
Thayu prakaṭ jāṇe kalyāṇ, nahi udhārī vātnī vāṇya; <RHYME_4>
Hoy parachā hajāro-hajār, jāṇe jan na jāṇe sansār.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should understand the importance of a good relationship (kalyāṇ) and not let opportunities pass by, just as the universe does not repeat itself. The universe is vast and unpredictable, but it is still governed by laws and principles.

transliteration.couplet:
Je koī satasangī nām kāve, pancha-vratne pāḷe paḷāve; <RHYME_5>
Te ā lok paralokne mānī, rahe sukhī te jan sadāī.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: One who has named themselves in a holy gathering and taken the five vows, will always remain peaceful and blessed. Their happiness is perpetual, both in this life and the next.

transliteration.couplet:
Je di āve ā dehno kāḷ, te di āve teḍavā dayāḷ; <RHYME_6>
Rath vel vimān ne vāji, mūke deh ghaṇu thaī rājī.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The merciful one shows compassion to the suffering soul, just as they would their own dear one. The Lord's chariot swiftly takes us across the ocean of rebirth, and we finally find peace in the kingdom of the self.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe āvyā chhe teḍavā Nāth, hu jāu chhu Mahārājne sāth; <RHYME_7>
Mānajyo māru hit-vachan, sahu Swāmīnu karajyo bhajan.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The summary is: "I am willing to follow the divine guidance of my true master, Mahārājne; and I will surrender to Him in devotion, following His orders."

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahīne mūke chhe deh, sarve jāṇe satasangī teh; <RHYME_8>
Kaik kusangī te paṇ jāṇe, thāy darshan prakaṭ pramāṇe.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: A person's true nature is known to all in a gathering of saints, and their virtues are clearly visible. Their hidden flaws become apparent only when they're alone with themselves.

transliteration.couplet:
Jyāre mare kusangīmā koī, najare Jam-kinkarne joī; <RHYME_9>
Jātā Jam-hāth joī kusangī, pachhī samajī thāy satasangī.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: One who does not understand the divine is blind, just like a person who cannot see despite having eyes. Only those who have realized the divine are enlightened, and that's why they join the gathering of saints.

transliteration.couplet:
Em vadhato jāy satasang, joī rītya chitte chaḍe rang; <RHYME_10>
Āve sant kare bahu vāt, te sāmbhaḷī thāy raḷiyāt.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: In the presence of a gathering of saints, one's soul becomes radiant with joy; their words bring solace to those who are lost and confused.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī Pūrṇa Puruṣhottam jeh, maḷe prakaṭ pramāṇ teh; <RHYME_11>
Tenā sant panchavrate pūrā, e āgaḷe bījā to adhūrā.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: A great soul's worth is revealed in their conduct, and a true saint's wisdom is beyond measure. A seed sown with good intentions will eventually bear fruit, regardless of external circumstances.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā sant shiromaṇī jeh, fare desh pradeshmā teh; <RHYME_12>
Jenā āganyākārī chhe ang, kedi na kare vachanno bhang.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: A peaceful soul is like a sweet fragrance that spreads across the world; even small acts of kindness can bring great joy and happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene āpiyu em vachan, jājyo tavare maḷī munijan; <RHYME_13>
Āvī shakyā to āvashu ame, nahi to nahājyo Narmadāmā tame.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: Even if the Lord says no, a true devotee will not depart; without devotion, even the Ganges River cannot purify one's soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī santne āganyā āpī, pachhī jāṇyu vadhyā ghaṇā pāpī; <RHYME_14>
Taiye kāḷne āganyā kīdhī, muvā pāpī jīv bahu vidhi.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context:
The wicked one who has committed many wrongdoings will suffer in the afterlife, while the pure-hearted person who does good deeds will be rewarded.

Good deeds bring happiness and a long life, whereas evil actions lead to suffering and short lifespan.

transliteration.couplet:
Pote chhānā rahyā ghaṇu Shyām, kāḷe kīdhu chhe kāḷnu kām; <RHYME_15>
Pote līdho tapasvīno vesh, rahyā gupta vadhāriyā kesh.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

A person named Shyam has his own pace and does not hurry; he knows what he wants to achieve.

This person, Shyam, wears the garb of an ascetic, but keeps his true intentions hidden.

transliteration.couplet:
Pahere khes ne oḍhe chofāḷ, māthe shobhe chhe sundar vāḷ; <RHYME_16>
Paherī ṭopī opī shobhā taṇī, Shyām mūrti te puṣhṭa chhe ghaṇī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful woman with a radiant face and lovely eyes, comparable to the beauty of a sacred idol.

transliteration.couplet:
Rahe chhānā na jāṇe koī jan, kare ekānti dās darshan; <RHYME_17>
Em vītī gayā bahu dan, koī jāṇī shake nahi jan.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: No one knows when their time will pass away, but they can have a private audience with God alone. One may do many good deeds, yet still be unaware of the consequences.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvyo chhe Vasant mās, suṇī vasant sāmbhariyā dās; <RHYME_18>
Pachhī boliyā dīndayāḷ, lāvo teḍī sant tatakāḷ.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The Vasant season has arrived, bringing with it the joy of spring and the happiness of giving; It's a time to share one's wealth and be kind to others.

transliteration.couplet:
Thaī khabar āviyā sant, vālo rājī ramavā Vasant; <RHYME_19>
Paherī vastra jarīnā jīvan, ghaṇu jan uparya prasanna.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: In the presence of a peaceful soul, one finds joy and comfort during spring. The gentle breeze brings pleasantness to life, filling others with delight.

transliteration.couplet:
Āve sant maḷe bharī bāth, juve amṛut draṣhṭie Nāth; <RHYME_20>
Ghaṇā dinnā jan hatā pyāsī, thayā tṛupta joī Avināshī.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The divine love is satiated with the sweet words of the Lord, and the soul drinks from it without thirst. The worldly desires are quenched, and the heart finds eternal peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Nāth kahe suṇo dās, ā to jāy chhe Fāgaṇ mās; <RHYME_21>
Gāvo fāg ne dhūm machāvo, nitya nāve avasar āvo.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The servant is asked to listen carefully as the master's words will come true in a few days; like the cow that chases the fog, one's luck changes suddenly with the seasons.

transliteration.couplet:
Karo ramavā taṇo samāj, em bolyā rājī thaī rāj; <RHYME_22>
Pachhī sante karyo sarājām, Hoḷī Harishu ramavā hām.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context:
Join the noble society, become a just king; Fulfill your duties and be like Lord Vishnu.

Inhabit the forest of peace, rejoice in God's presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī kaḍhāvyo rang sorang, kesu kesar kasumbo patang; <RHYME_23>
Bharyā charu kaḍāyā ne kaḍā, vaḷī goḷā māṭalā ne ghaḍā.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context:
The colors of the sunset dance and play, like a kite soaring in the sky.
A husband's words are as sweet as honey, and a wife's love is like a fragrance that fills the air.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāvyā tel gulāl abīr, sajja thayā sakhā shūrvīr; <RHYME_24>
Pachhī Nāth kahe suṇo jan, āpo amane sakhā thaī prasan.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a newlywed couple, their love and togetherness being compared to the vibrant colors of henna and turmeric. The second line emphasizes the importance of listening to the wise words of one's partner in marriage.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī dash-vīsh sakhā līdhā, beu ṭoḷā barobar kīdhā; <RHYME_25>
Sānkhya-yogī sakhā Shyām sāthe, līdhī hem pichkārī hāthe.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the couplet:

A friend who has 10 qualities is hard to find, and even if found, it's like finding a needle in a haystack. Even among yogis, one as fortunate as Shyam is rare.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī magāviyo rang pāse, bharī pichkārī Avināshe; <RHYME_26>
Chhānṭī ek ek sahu māthe, pachhī nākhyo chhe gulāl Nāthe.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A person's colors fade away like sunset, and their memories are filled with regret when they look back; Just as the fragrance of a flower petal is released only after it falls to the ground.

transliteration.couplet:
Sakhā sahu thayā rangchoḷ, pachhī machyo chhe khel atoḷ; <RHYME_27>
Chhūṭe pichkārī bahu chhoḷe, ekbījāne zālīne roḷe.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The couple's happiness and laughter are contagious, spreading joy to all around them. Their love is so strong that it makes others cry out in envy.

transliteration.couplet:
Nākhe upar abīr gulāl, teṇe sakhā thayā sahu lāl; <RHYME_28>
Vāje ḍhol ne dadāmā gaḍe, kāsā trānsānī dhrosh ja paḍe.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The aroma of rose petals spreads upwards, a friend's sweet words lift the soul; The beat of the drum takes us on a journey, as emotions and tears flow freely.

transliteration.couplet:
Lathbath jūth rame hoḷī, sām-sāmī chhe sarakhī ṭoḷī; <RHYME_29>
Nāth upar nākhyo chhe rang, teṇe shobhe chhe sundar ang.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: A person's beauty lies in their gentle nature, not just physical appearance. True beauty shines when one's inner and outer selves are in harmony.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve vastra rangāṇā anganā, shvet lāl thayā ek rangnā; <RHYME_30>
Mukh lāl ne kamaḷneṇ, shobhe sundar te sukhdeṇ.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: All clothes are colorful in the courtyard, but a white lotus stands out on its own; A beautiful smile is like a precious gem that brings joy to others.

transliteration.couplet:
Hasave dīse chhe dant-pangati, ope anārkaḷīthī ati; <RHYME_31>
Bāndhyu bokānu sundar fenṭe, kasī kamar rūpāḷe renṭe.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful maiden who has lost her way in the wilderness, but still shines like a gem. Her beauty is so radiant that it outshines even the brightest stars in the night sky.

transliteration.couplet:
Chhūṭī kasmā dīse chhe chhātī, tenī shobhā kahī nathī jātī; <RHYME_32>
Veḍh vīṭī ne kaḍā chhe hāthe, Nāth rame chhe sakhāne sāthe.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: A person's beauty is not defined by their social status, as even a poor person can be attractive. True beauty lies in the hands that work hard and earn their livelihood with honesty.

transliteration.couplet:
Hoḍāhoḍmā koī na hāre, vachchmā paḍī koī na vāre; <RHYME_33>
Em ramatā jām beu giyā, maṭī bapor chhāyā namiyā.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: No one can defeat the patient and determined one, nor can they be held back from their journey; just like a cloud that overshadows the land, their glory will be revealed in due time.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Nāthe hāthe pāḍī tāḷī, kare nāmnī dhūnya rasāḷī; <RHYME_34>
Karī dhūnya kahe em vālo, sarve nadīe nāvāne chālo.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that the path of spiritual growth is not easily found, but with devotion, one can taste the essence of the world. It also advises to let go of worldly attachments and move forward like rivers flowing towards their destination.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī pote chaḍiyā chhe ghoḍe, sakhā jūth sarave chhe joḍe; <RHYME_35>
Nāvā nīrmā peṭhā chhe Nāth, sahu nāhyā chhe Shyāmne sāth.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The path to the Lord's abode is narrow and difficult, but all brothers are together in this journey. One should not be led astray by worldly attachments, as true companionship comes from following the divine path with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Nāhī Nāth ne nīsaryā bāre, karyo kumkumno indu tyāre; <RHYME_36>
Pachhī ashve thayā asavār, āvyā Mahārāj gām mozār.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The king's duties are not limited to his throne, he must also look after the welfare of his people; He should travel through the land to understand the needs of his subjects.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sant sarve te āvyā, thaī rasoī jamavā bolāvyā; <RHYME_37>
Pachhī pīrasyu potāne hāthe, em jamāḍiyā jan Nāthe.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The beloved saints of all eras speak with a sweet tone, their words dripping like nectar from a jug. The lord's devotees, bound by the threads of love, utter prayers that echo in the heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve rīte kīdhā sukhī sant, karī līlā alauki atyant; <RHYME_38>
Din dash sudhī sant rahyā, pachhī pote vaḷāvāne gayā.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: A peaceful saint is happy in all seasons, but their playfulness is extreme; after a day's hard work, they wander off to enjoy the evening.

transliteration.couplet:
Kāriyāṇī ne Kunḍaḷ gāma, tiyā sudhī āvyā pote Shyām; <RHYME_39>
Pachhī sahune shīkh ja karī, pote pāchhā vaḷiyā chhe Hari.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
A traveler's wife, Kariyani, left her husband Kunthal and took shelter with Shyam; later, she returned to her husband's village with a changed heart.

She then lived with her husband again, understanding the pain of separation like Lord Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Evo karyo samaiyo jīvane, Fāgaṇ sudi Pūnamne dine; <RHYME_40>
Tedi Gaḍhaḍe ramiyā Hoḷī, sukhī thaī gayā sant ṭoḷī.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: In this life, we should cherish each moment and day, for happiness is fleeting like the morning dew. One should enjoy their youth with passion and live a peaceful life like a contented saint.
